comments:
This work could correspond to the "large commentary" listed by Las chen along with a "small commentary." [BKUHJCNA]: 724 (rgyas pa'i bstan bcos tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi rnam bshad che chung gnyis). The identity of this short version is unclear. 

In the colophon he credits the teachings of Red mda' ba (ID: 6756), Tsong kha pa (ID: 5636), and Kun dga' dpal (ID: 7075).

comments:
In spite of the editorial title on the cover page of instance (ID:4776) identifying it as a commentary on the Pramāṇa­vārttika­ (ID:3772), this work belongs rather to the category of summaries. 
It was composed after 1219, as it refers to the Tshad ma rigs gter (ID:5564).
It also addresses the views of a number of Indian commentators and anonymous opponents, including some referred to as "Tibetans" (bod kha cig), and refers with name to Phya pa (ID:3831).
name: tshad ma rnam 'grel rnam par 'byed pa

comments:
Study of the Pramāṇavārttika (ID:3772) written during the late 13th or early fourteenth century ([FEHIEFEB]: 124).
Mentioned Ral gri's list of his writings (ID:7112) and the list by bSam gtan bzang po (ID:4005). See [FZ6N88AU]: 409.

comments:
The chapter colophon indicates that this work is a commentary on the Pramāṇaviniścaya (ID:3774), which covers the third chapter (on inference for others).
Frequent use of consequences. Few references to other views, by Dharmottara and some anonymous proponents.

comments:
Commentary on the Pramāṇaviniścaya (ID:3774) making abundant use of arguments in thal-phyir format, with use of the pronoun "khyod" as a variable, to explain the base text. The Pramāṇaviniścaya is not cited, but initial syllables of the passages addressed by the commentary have been added below the lines in instance (ID:5270).
The identity of the author is uncertain and it is not clear whether the same "Rin chen tshul khrims" was the author of this work and of work (ID:6991).

name: tshad ma rnam nges kyi legs par bshad pa 'grel bshad kun las btus pa'i snying po nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi snang ba

comments:
This work can be identified with the "large commentary" mentioned by Las chen along with a lost "short commentary" (ID:6008) ([BKUHJCNA]: 724) (see <<van der Kuijp 1989 [H9MPLMTV]>>: 20). 
In addition to the version in rGyal tshab's collected works, the second half of the work was also published by sKu 'bum byams pa gling in Amdo (http://purl.bdrc.io/resource/W4CZ74541). 

A 328-folio blockprint of the first half is preserved in the Library of the Hungarian Academy of Sciences ([GRGSH98H], no. 215).
A 307-folio dbu can manuscript of the first half and a 260-folio manuscript of the second half are preserved at Se ra. See [HMSTSJ7Q]: 387 (gDan sa chen po se ra theg chen gling gi tshogs chen yang thog gzims chung du bzhugs su gsol ba'i dpe rnying dkar chag), No. 1993: ga 25; bstan bcos tshad ma rnam nges kyi tIk chen dgongs pa rab gsal gyi stod cha; rgyal tshab dar ma rin chen; dbu can; 307 fols.; 59 x 10 cm and No. 1995: ga 26; bstan bcos tshad ma rnam nges kyi tIk chen dgongs pa rab gsal gyi smad cha; rgyal tshab rje; dbu can; 260 fols; 59 x 10 cm.
alternative_names:
bstan bcos tshad ma rnam nges kyi TIk chen dgongs pa rab gsal
rnam nges kyi rnam bshad chen mo rgyal ba'i dgongs pa rab gsal
tshad ma rnam nges TIk chen
rnam nges dar tik
name: tshad ma rnam nges kyi rnam bshad theg gsum lam du bgrod pa rgyal ba'i dgongs pa rab gsal

comments:
One of the two works composed by Ral gri on the Pramāṇaviniścaya (ID:3774) according to the list of his writings (ID:7112), which mentions a "sa bcad" - presumably a topical outline - and a "ti ka," which corresponds to work (ID:4942).
See [FZ6N88AU]: 409.
name: tshad ma rnam nges kyi sa bcad

comments:
Commentary on the three chapters of the Pramāṇaviniścaya, abundantly using "thal...phyir" arguments. It is possibly incomplete - it ends abruptly, but has a colophon.
Contains numerous references to Indian commentators of the Pramāṇaviniścaya (ID:3774), Pramāṇavārttika (ID:3772) and Pramāṇasamuccaya (ID:3770), as well as to the views of rNgog Blo ldan shes rab (ID:3786), of Chu mig pa (ID:4018), and to the Tshad ma rigs gter (ID:5564).
Also referred to are an anonymous "yongs 'dzin" and the unidentified reference "sgros."
alternative_names: tshad rnam par nges pa'i TIk+kka blo gsal gyi mgul
name: tshad ma rnam nges kyi TIk+ka blo gsal mgul rgyan

comments:
This work only deals with selected portions of the Pramaṇaviniścaya (ID:3774). The author systematically examines Dharmottara's commentary on these passages in the Pramaṇaviniścayaṭīkā and frequently adduces also the interpretation of other Indian exegetes of Dharmakirti, such as Prajñākaragupta, Śaṅkaranandana, Śākyabuddhi and Kamalaśīla.
A "bsdus don/don bsdus" is listed by several Tibetan scholars along with a "rnam bshad chen po" (see <<Kano 2016 [BAQ9MH4T]>>: 205). The dKa' gnas rnam par bshad pa could correspond to the former, while the latter would not be extant (ID: 6082), or could be yet a third composition ([GHC9CLWS]: 202). 
Shākya mchog ldan also mentions in [TM8DW8WA] the pair of commentaries in terms of "rnam nges dka' 'grel" and "rnam nges Tik chen" (see <<Hugon 2008 [SRQNNEPT]>>: 20). However in his commentaries on the Rigs gter, he uses the expressions "rnam par nges pa'i TIka" and "rnam par nges pa'i rnam bshad." It is yet uncertain whether the two expressions refer to the same work, or if two different works are meant, and whether one of them could be the extant dKa' gnas rnam bshad. The comparison of the citations with the extant work shows many literal parallels but also differences (see [SRQNNEPT]: 21-22 for the details).

comments:
One of the two works composed by Ral gri on the Pramāṇaviniścaya (ID:3774) according to the list of his writings (ID:7112), which mentions it as a "ti ka," along with a "sa bcad" (see (ID:7117)).
This commentary was composed later than his epistemological summary (ID:4994), to which it refers twice (see [V4DZTVU8]: 305 and [FZ6N88AU]: 409).
According to the colophon, it relies on the tradition of instructions from Dānaśīla (ID:6032). The author refers several times to the views of "previous teachers" (sngon gyi slob dpon kha cig) without naming them.

comments:
Extensive commentary on Dharmakīrti's Pramāṇaviniścaya, organized in a hierarchical structure, with a division of three chapters superimposed to this structure in the central part. It includes excursuses, some of which find an exact parallel in Phya pa's Yid kyi mun sel (ID:4503).

The work probably corresponds to the text listed by A khu shes rab rgya mtsho in the Tho yig (<<Chandra 1963 [AB49GQ2P]>>: 673, no. 11803: phya pa chos seng ge tshad ma rnam nges kyi 'grel ba).

The author discusses the view of other Tibetan scholars more than 100 times without naming them, whereas Indian scholars are referred to by name.
alternative_names:
slob dpon chen po phywa pa chos kyi seng ges mdzad pa'i tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad
phya pa chos seng ge tshad ma rnam nges kyi 'grel ba
tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad yi ge dang rigs pa'i gnad la 'jug pa'i shes rab kyi 'od zer
tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad yi ge dang rig pa'i gnad la 'jug pa'i shes rab kyi 'od zer
tshad ma rnam par nges pa’i ‘grel pa
name: tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad shes rab kyi 'od zer

comments:
The author makes ca. 200 anonymous references to the views of other scholars; only rNgog Blo ldan shes rab (ID:3786) and Sa skya paṇḍita (ID:3892) are named in the text, which also cites a quatrain from the latter's mKhas pa rnams la 'jug pa'i sgo (see [FZ6N88AU]: 430, n. 77).
The author's views testify to a combination of the respective systems stemming from these two scholars.
alternative_names:

tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad
name: tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad tshig don rnam par nges pa nyi ma'i snying po

comments:
Versified commentary on the Pramāṇaviniścaya (ID:3774).
This work could correspond to the "tshad ma rigs pa'i rgyan" taught by sKyi ston (ID:4221) to Dol po pa (ID:4213) ([FZ6N88AU]: 430, n. 78).

name: tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel pa rin po che rigs pa'i rgyan

comments:
Commentary on the PVin providing a summary of perception and inference at the beginning. 
The chapter colophons give the tilte "don gsal byed kyi me long."
Composed after 1219, as it cites the Tshad ma rigs gter (ID:5564) several times.
Extensive use of chains of consequences.

comments:
Commentary on the Pramāṇaviniścaya (ID:3774) that takes into account both Dharmottara's and Jñānaśrībhadra's Pramāṇaviniścayaṭīkā ((ID:5594), (ID:5597)), and relies on the teachings of rGya Shes rab dbang phyug (ID:4023) and 'Jang Shag kya dpal (ID:4022) (see ex87012023-03-0911-03-47).

The author mostly refers to the views of other Tibetan scholars anonymously, but names Phya pa (ID:3831) and Lo tsha ba (ID:3786) - also referring to "lo tsha ba'i ti ka," i.e., (ID:4445) or (ID:6082) - and a yet identified "'ba'."

Composed in gSang phu (ID:6173) and initially written down in Khra 'brug (ID:5596) (see (ID:5869).
alternative_names:
legs bshad bstan pa'i 'od zer
tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel
ti ka chen po
tshad ma rnaM nges kyi ti ka
name: tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i ti ka chen po legs bshad bstan pa'i 'od zer

comments:
Extensive commentary spanning 210 folios in instance (ID:4549), including as well numerous excursuses. The author discusses the views of numerous Tibetan opponents who are not identifies by name (ca. 160 occurrences of "kha cig" in the work).

It corresponds to the work listed by A khu shes rab rgya mtsho in the Tho yig ([5RXEUKD9]: 539, No. 11807: gtsang nag pa'i rnam nges Tik chen).

See [H9MPLMTV] for an introduction to the work, its author, and the manuscript.

Incipit: ex1301_10152023-06-283 ex013012025-05-2117-53-13
Conclusion: ex013012025-05-2118-06-28 ex1301_1232023-06-282
alternative_names:

tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i Tikka
tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i Ti ka legs bshad bsdus pa
tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i ti ka legs par bshad pa bsdus pa
gtsang nag pa'i rnam nges Tik chen
pramāṇaviniścayasya ṭīkā
name: tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i ti ka legs par bshad pa bsdus pa

comments:
Epistemological summary, structured according to a hierarchical organization and a division into five chapters.

The author refers over 100 times to the views of other Tibetan scholars, including his own teacher(s), without naming them. rNgog blo ldan shes rab (ID:3786) is referred to three times as "blo ldan bzang po."

The <<Deb ther sngon po [R894SIKE]>>: 405 reports a Yid kyi mun sel in verses with commentary and a Yid kyi mun sel without commentary. 
A khu shes rab rgya mtsho similarly lists two entries in the Tho yig ([5RXEUKD9]: 673, No. 11804: tshad ma'i bsdus pa yid kyi mun sel rang 'grel dang bcas pa, No. 11805: tshad bsdus yid kyi mun sel rkyang pa gcig). The extant version - instance (ID:4502) - is in prose only.
alternative_names:
slob dpon chen po phywa pa chos kyi seng ges mdzad pa'i tshad ma yid kyi mun sel
tshad ma bsdus pa yid kyi mun sel
mun sel
tshad ma yid kyi mun pa sel ba
phra ma na ma naḥ ta maḥ tā na ba nā ma
pramāṇamanastamastānavam
name: tshad ma yid kyi mun sel

comments:
Epistemological work in five chapters, also organized according to a nested hierarchy (sa bcad). The author mentions in the closing verses the triad "'chad rtsom brtsod" as well as the pairs of topics "'gal/'brel," "dgag/sgrub," and "rdzas chos/ldog chos."

The author refers anonymously to the view of a number of other scholars, who are often identified in glosses in instance (ID:4790). These glosses name ca. 20 different figures. The most-cited are gTsang nag pa (ID:3839), Dan 'bag pa (ID:3840), Phya pa (ID:3831), and rNgog Blo ldan shes rab (ID:3786).

comments:
Explanation of the meaning of the Pañcaviṃśatisāhasrikā Prajñāpāramitā (ID:3691) together with Āryavimuktisena's commentary (ID:3707) or (ID:5935), relying on rNgog Blo ldan shes rab (ID:3786)'s explanations (gsung sgros), written as a memorandum. The author also cites Haribhadra's Abhisamayālaṇkārālokā (ID:3709) and refers as well to "rje btsun," probably Bhadantavimuktisena (ID:5548).

This work may correspond to the commentary listed in A khu ching Shes rab rgya mtsho's Tho yig ([5RXEUKD9]: 529, No. 11492: gro lung pa'i nyi khri'i 'grel pa).
alternative_names:
dge bshes gro lung pas mdzad pa'i yum bar pa nyi khri'i rnam bshad
nyi khri'i 'grel pa
gro lung pa'i nyi khri'i 'grel pa
rgyal ba’i yum bar ma le'u brgyad pa nyi khri lnga stong ba mdo' 'grel rnam par bshad pa
name: yum bar pa nyi khri'i rnam bshad

comments: Based on the interpretation of Jo bo 'bum (ID: 5611) and rNgog Blo ldan shes rab (ID: 3786), who is credited with having previously composed such a work in the colophon, presumably in (ID: 6197) or (ID: 6048) according to [BAQ9MH4T]: 202-203, n. 49. These two works are not extant, and might be identical. The second is entitled "yum brgyad stong pa'i 'grel pa'i don bsdus" and the first "yum brgyad stong pa'i don bsdus," but it is said to be based on Haribhadra's interpretation.
alternative_names:
'bre shes rab 'bar gyis mdzad pa'i yum brgyad stong pa'i don bsdus
rgyal ba'i yum gyi bsdus don
bcom ldan 'das yum brgyad stong pa'i don bsdus pa
name: yum brgyad stong pa'i don bsdus

comments: Mentioned in the colophon of 'Bre shes rab 'bar's work by the same title (ID: 4449). As it is not otherwise included in lists of rNgog Blo ldan shes rab's works, it could be identical with the latter's "don bsdus" on one of Haribhadra's commentaries, (ID: 6048) or (ID: 4435), since the colophon claims that rNgog Blo ldan shes rab's work "follows Haribhadra."
name: yum brgyad stong pa'i don bsdus
